summary: This bill, the Sickle Cell Disease Comprehensive Care Act, amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to allow state Medicaid programs to offer comprehensive, coordinated healthcare through health homes to individuals with sickle cell disease. It mandates the provision of dental and vision services for eligible individuals enrolled in such health homes, requires states to submit reports on the quality of care and expenditures, and directs the Secretary to publish best practices. The bill defines eligible individuals, sickle cell disease, and sets reporting and implementation deadlines.
